contentrichtext.text: {{otherships|USS Murray}} {|{{Infobox ship begin}} {{Infobox ship image |Ship image=[[Image:USSMurrayDD97.jpg|300px|USS Murray (DD-97)]] |Ship caption= }} {{Infobox Ship Career |Hide header= |Ship country=US |Ship flag={{USN flag|1922}} |Ship name= |Ship namesake=[[Alexander Murray (1816–1884)|Alexander Murray]] |Ship ordered= |Ship builder=[[Fore River Shipyard]], [[Quincy, Massachusetts|Quincy]], [[Massachusetts]] |Ship laid down=22 December 1917 |Ship launched=8 June 1918 |Ship acquired= |Ship commissioned=21 August 1918 |Ship reclassified=17 July 1920 |Ship decommissioned=1 July 1922 |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship struck=7 January 1936 |Ship reinstated= |Ship honours= |Ship fate=Sold for scrap, 29 September 1936 |Ship status= |Ship notes= }} {{Infobox ship characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship class=[[Wickes class destroyer]] |Ship displacement=1,191 tons |Ship length=314 ft 5 in (95.83 m) |Ship beam=31 ft 9 in (9.68 m) |Ship draft=9 ft 2 in (2.79 m) |Ship propulsion= |Ship speed=35 knots (65 km/h) |Ship range= |Ship complement=113 officers and enlisted |Ship sensors= |Ship EW= |Ship armament=4 x 4" (102 mm), 2 x 1-pdr., 12 x 21" (533 mm) tt. |Ship armor= |Ship aircraft= |Ship aircraft facilities= |Ship notes= }} |} The second '''USS ''Murray'' (DD-97)''' was a [[Wickes class destroyer|''Wickes''-class]] [[destroyer]] in the [[United States Navy]] during [[World War I]]. She was named for Commodore [[Alexander Murray (1755-1821)|Alexander Murray]] and Commodore Murray's grandson, [[Alexander Murray (1816–1884)|Alexander Murray]]{{Which|date=April 2013|reason=Citation needed for either or both.}}. ==History== ''Murray'' was laid down 22 December 1917 by [[Fore River Shipbuilding Corporation]], [[Quincy, Massachusetts|Quincy]], [[Massachusetts]]; launched 8 June 1918; sponsored by Miss [[Alice S. Guthrie]]; and commissioned at [[Boston, Massachusetts|Boston]] 21 August 1918, Lieutenant Commander [[R. G. Walling]] in command. During her 4 years of operations along the East Coast and in the [[Caribbean]] with the [[U.S. Atlantic Fleet|Atlantic Fleet]], ''Murray'' aided in postwar development of antisubmarine and mine warfare techniques. She was reclassified to a light [[minelayer]] ('''DM-2''') 17 July 1920, and received alterations necessary to her new role. She decommissioned at [[Philadelphia, Pennsylvania|Philadelphia]] 1 July 1922, and lay there in reserve until stricken from the [[Naval Vessel Register|Navy list]] 7 January 1936. She was sold for scrapping 29 September 1936 to [[Schiavone-Bonomo Corporation]], [[New York, New York|New York City]]. ==See also== *See [[USS Murray|USS ''Murray'']] for other ships of this name. *[[List of United States Navy destroyers]] ==References== *{{DANFS|http://www.history.navy.mil/danfs/m16/murray-ii.htm}} ==External links== *[http://www.navsource.org/archives/05/097.htm NavSource DD-97] {{Wickes class destroyer}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Murray (DD-97)}} [[Category:Wickes-class destroyers]] [[Category:World War I destroyers of the United States]] [[Category:Ships built in Massachusetts]] [[Category:1918 ships]] [[Category:Wickes-class destroyer minelayers]]
